text: His might, his celestial army, ultimately fell to a greater force. The legend of the Dragon God’s champion ends here.
The young dragon might have once parted clouds and stirred waves, but now she can no longer make a splash.
Now that the new star of Cathay has fallen, how much longer can the empire behind him endure?
Look at these glittering divine weapons—they all belong to me now...
Trust me, without their leader, these temporarily unified forces will crumble in an instant.
In the past, she soared in her final moments; today, she falls into the abyss at White Gate.
The guardian of the Southern Frontier can no longer protect his celestial empire.
Han Cheng? His Celestial Treasure Sage and his rebellion are mere amusements in the eyes of the Dragon God.
No tyrant, no matter how cruel, can plunge the world into eternal darkness.
Jade bones are not eternal; how long can they linger in this realm?
Your fate is not decided by the heavens... but by me.
The kings of the northern deserts bow at His feet, for the destruction of Cathay is His destined path.

Huo Su participated in quelling the Six Counties Rebellion during the civil war, serving as governor of the three gates of the Great Bastion. Later, Yuan Bo appointed him "Flying Cavalry General". Renowned for his archery and horsemanship, he frequently led northern expeditions with Yi Qing, earning the fear of the Zhag tribes.
This commander is one of the leaders of the Hedong Volunteer Army, who rose up alongside the peasant army and continues to fight to this day.
To the people of Cathay, the lands north of the Great Bastion represent chaos and death. But for the frontier army stationed beyond, the endless wars have forged chaos and death into a way of life.
Frontier Army of the Great Bastion

Vast fleets of Celestial Ships are stationed across the empire. Each fleet is typically divided into three squadrons, with a commander leading each, enabling precise execution of complex battlefield tactics.
When you see the Lord of the Heavenly Palace, why do you not bow?
Great Buddha of the Setting Sun
Taming a Longma is a rare honor, but to use it for personal gain indebts one to the Dragon Emperor.

Feng Yaochu served under Zhao Ming the Iron Dragon as a cavalry commander. Renowned for his unmatched bravery, he was later promoted to General of the Middle Army and titled Marquis of Taizi, earning the moniker "Flying General".

During the Southern Peace, the rulers of the mountains hosted a grand feast for the army. Twenty-eight star generals were named, their resolve towering like mountains, their followers as countless as the stars. These generals achieved unparalleled feats, becoming the backbone of the empire, whether at court or on the battlefield.
The official removed his veil, revealing whiskers and the face of a giant rat. The matron fainted as the great rat seized the bride, summoned a jade wind, and vanished into the night.
Legend has it that Hou Qian acquired his artifacts from the old sage of Kunlan. Since he no longer needs them, they are mine now.
Listen closely—the wind carries the sound of unfulfilled desires.

The generals of the Shen Ce Fu immediately responded, dispatching armies to suppress the rebellion. Three columns advanced, only to be defeated by the King of Nanyang. General Tianxian was surrounded by "Lord Xuanhuan" at Gravefield and pierced by countless arrows; General Mingjing was deceived by "Marquis Jingji" into a banquet where his tendons were severed; General Hupu, unmatched in battle, was blinded by a spear thrust from "Marquis Wuqiu". The strategists of Shen Ce Fu were helpless as the King of Nanyang seemed to anticipate their every move, crushing the generals who once swept the north.
The emissaries appointed by the tribal leaders will remain stationed in the empire, acting as vanguard agents for other Order factions.
Commanders are responsible for the defense of critical regions, selected from the battle-hardened generals of Cathay.

Right Wise King Wuda Ruodi greatly unified the southern tribes of the steppes, introduced many technologies and texts from Cathay, advancing the Sinicization of the nomadic regimes. He maintained close ties with the frontier army, and together they launched numerous campaigns against the northern Chaos tribes.
He spent his life battling in the void, but now he can return home.
Each province arms its own, marching to war for hearth and home—today is the day!
The Grand Preceptor was right—see, the fish came after all.
It's all for your own good...
You wish to change the story's course? Very well—if it’s you, perhaps it’s possible...
You are not alone... even mortals walk with you.

By this decree, I grant you the Tristar Banner and the Celestial Axe to judge before plea. Command the Five Guards and Two Armies. Govern Fifteen Provinces and Eighty-One Prefectures. Wield Heaven’s Sword and wage war for the Way.
In His name, remove all obstacles.
Acquired by: Declaring full war upon first contact with Lizardmen in Yuan Bo’s storyline
For the best possible ending, no cost is too great.
Acquired by: Pursuing diplomacy with the Lizardmen through repeated crises in Yuan Bo’s storyline
What seems a trifle may break the tune; a string retuned may not resound.
Acquired by: Declaring war on the Celestial Court and seizing Weijing in Yuan Bo’s storyline
